citation.article-title: Transfer of Bacteroides succinogenes (Hungate) to Fibrobacter gen. nov. as Fibrobacter succinogenes comb. nov. and description of Fibrobacter intestinalis sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Fibrobacter intestinalis sp. nov.
Fibrobacter intestinalis (in.tes.ti.nal'is. L. adj. intestinalis, pertaining to the intestine)
Cells are rods (0.3 to 0.4 by 0.8 to 2.0 Î¼m) which form spheroplasts after ceasing growth.
Colonies in cellobiose agar are like those of Fibrobacter succinogenes.
Clear zones are formed in cellulose agar containing ca. 0.5 to 0.6% agar, but colonies are indistinct and transient in the absence of fermentable sugar.
Broth cultures are evenly turbid, forming a smooth sediment.
The vitamins required are cyanocobalamine (BIZ), PABA, and sometimes thiamine.
Habitats include mammalian intestines and rumina.
The type strain is strain NR9 (= ATCC 43854), which is described in reference 27 and Table 3.
